parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Slurm",
  "details": {
    "account": "cds",
    "gpu": "rtx8000",
    "gpu_count": 1,
    "cpus": 4,
    "memory": "200GB",
    "time": "48:00:00",
    "job_name": "cache_igpt",
    "output_file": "cache_igpt_%A_%a.out",
    "array_tasks": 6,
    "modules": [
      "cuda/11.1.74"
    ],
    "python_script": "/scratch/eo41/image-gpt/cache.py",
    "python_script_args": {
      "print_freq": 10,
      "batch_size": 16,
      "model_size": "l",
      "prly": "${PARRAY[`expr $SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID % ${#PARRAY[@]}`]}",
      "partition": "${v=`expr $SLURM_ARRAY_TASK_ID / ${#PARRAY[@]}`}",
      "fragment": "val",
      "model_path": "/scratch/eo41/image-gpt/models/l/model.ckpt-1000000.index",
      "cluster_path": "/scratch/eo41/image-gpt/models/l/kmeans_centers.npy",
      "val_path": "/scratch/eo41/imagenet_st/"
    }
  }
}
```

The script is running under the **Slurm** workload manager. It uses the **cuda/11.1.74** module for GPU acceleration and executes a **Python** script named **cache.py**.  The script takes several arguments related to the training process, including model size, batch size, and data paths. It also leverages **Slurm's array job functionality** to run the script across multiple tasks, each with a specific set of parameters.
